head.supplied: 10 Jan 1881 ¶ ¶ We have the honor to recommend Mr. S. H. Wintle of George Bay (Tasm.) as a fellow of the Linnéan Society, to which distinction he has some claim by his entomologic and paleontologic r...

div.p: To the Linnean Society of London
Linnean Society, London, Certificates of Fellows, Foreign Members and Associates, 1877-82

We have the honor to recommend Mr. S. H. Wintle of George Bay (Tasm.) as a fellow of the Linnéan Society, to which distinction he has some claim by his entomologic and paleontologic researches in Tasmania, carried on for many years

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Ferd. von Mueller, M.D., F.L.S.
M autograph manuscript and signature, other supporters' individual signatures.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;

div.p:
Samuel Wilson F.L.S., F.R.G.S
M and Woolls were two of the supporters when Wintle was elected in the previous year, see M to Linnean Society of London, January 1880 (in this edition as 80-01-00c). It is not known why a second nomination was submitted. An undated obligation form (agreeing to pay the fees while a Fellow) signed by Wintle is filed with this letter and the 1880 form.
